text: though it looks like other octopuses the
larger Pacific striped octopus seems to
break all the octopus rules first it
hunts its shrimp prey unlike any other
instead of pouncing on its victim it
starts by slowly stretching out its
dorsal arm sneaking up almost is it to
give it a hug after a tap on the
shoulder the surprise shrimp is quickly
consumed
also unusual for an octopus the larger
Pacific striped octopus is not
cannibalistic so when they mate the
male's of the species have no fear of
being eaten the mating pair grasp each
other's arms
sucker to sucker beak to beak once they
lay their eggs the females don't die
like most octopuses but are able to keep
mating and have more offspring despite
being known to scientists that study
them as the most antisocial animal alive
the larger Pacific striped octopus is
pretty warm and fuzzy for a cephalopod
you
